metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13704 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
In dnsmasq before 2.78, if the DNS packet size does not match the expected size, the size parameter in a memset call gets a negative value. As it is an unsigned value, memset ends up writing up to 0xffffffff zero's (0xffffffffffffffff in 64 bit platforms), making dnsmasq crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13704` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.68-1ubuntu0.1
dnsmasq-base - 2.68-1ubuntu0.1
dnsmasq-utils - 2.68-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Christian Kujau, Arne Woerner, Juan Manuel Fernandez and Kevin Darbyshire-Bryant

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.68-1ubuntu0.1').
